info.title: Preventing node fencing during a kernel dump

abstract.para: The stonith:fence_kdump plug-in checks if a kernel dump (kdump) is in progress on a node. If so, it returns true and acts as if the node has been fenced, because the node will reboot after the kdump is complete. If not, it returns a failure and the next fencing device is triggered.

The kdump plug-in must be used together with a physical &stonith; device. It does not work with &sbd;. For the fencing mechanism to work properly, you must specify the order of the fencing devices so that kdump is checked before a real &stonith; device is triggered, as shown in the following procedure.

listitem.para: The cluster uses a physical &stonith; device for node fencing.
Cluster resources for the &stonith; device are already configured.
kdump is installed and configured on all nodes.

topic.para: Perform this procedure on only one node in the cluster:

step.para: Log in either as the &rootuser; user or as a user with sudo privileges.
Use the stonith:fence_kdump fence agent. A configuration example is shown below. For more information, see crm ra info stonith:fence_kdump.
step.screen: &prompt.crm.conf;primitive st-kdump stonith:fence_kdump \ params nodename="&node1; "\ pcmk_host_list="&node1;" \ timeout="60"

callout.para: Name of the node to listen for a message from fence_kdump_send. Configure more &stonith; resources for other nodes if needed.

Defines how long to wait for a message from fence_kdump_send. If a message is received, then a kdump is in progress and the fencing mechanism considers the node to be fenced. If no message is received, fence_kdump times out, which indicates that the fence operation failed. The next &stonith; device in the fencing_topology eventually fences the node.

step.para: To have kdump checked before triggering a real fencing mechanism (like external/ipmi), use a configuration similar to the following:
Open the firewall port for fence_kdump on all nodes:
Configure fence_kdump_send to send a message to all nodes when the kdump process is finished:
In the /etc/sysconfig/kdump file, edit the KDUMP_POSTSCRIPT line. For example:
Replace NODELIST with the host names of all the cluster nodes.
Copy the /etc/sysconfig/kdump file to the rest of the nodes:
Restart the kdump service on all nodes:
step.screen: &prompt.user;sudo crm cluster run "sudo systemctl restart kdump.service"
step.para: This regenerates initrd so that it includes the library fence_kdump_send with network enabled.
